unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify the assumptions that underpin language teaching and learning materials.
Analyse a range of language teaching approaches, activities and techniques for each of the four language skills (reading, writing, speaking and listening) and for grammar and vocabulary.
Relate research findings to effective language teaching approaches and techniques.
Evaluate issues in second language teaching and learning and provide evidence of critical engagement with current literature to support your evaluation.
Critically evaluate different theories regarding second language learning and teaching.
Based on current literature, describe and evaluate the effects of a range of individual and contextual factors on language learning.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to read set readings for this unit prior to scheduled seminar-workshops. In addition, they are expected to revise notes from the seminar-workshops, so that they can apply the concepts well to their assessment tasks.

assessments.assessment_title: Literature review of theories on second language teaching and learning
assessments.description: Students are asked to conduct and write a 1500 word literature review on the changes to the approaches to second language teaching and learning since the 1980s.

assessments.assessment_title: Issue in Second Language Teaching and Learning
assessments.description: Students are asked to choose a topic from a given set of choices on issues in second language teaching and learning. They will then have to write a 2500 word argumentative essay showing relevant in-depth understanding of the issue, critical summary of the relevant literature, and sound research-based arguments to support their thesis.

Students are asked to present their (changing) views regarding one issue in second language learning and teaching in class in either Week 11 or 12. Their presentation should reflect the theories and concepts learned in class which have underpinned the shift (or not) in their beliefs.

Students are asked to analyse a language textbook unit in regards to the teaching approach used, the activities offered, and the overall layout of the lesson. Applying the theories, approaches and teaching strategies learned in the seminars, they are to write a 1500 word critical analysis to show their understanding of the pedagogical principles that underpin the unit chosen.

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: This unit is intended as a general introduction to major issues in second language teaching and learning. It deals with the theory and practice of learning and teaching second languages. Authentic language data and teaching materials are used in order to present the second language learning experience from both the learner's and the teacher's perspective. Issues covered include: processes in second language acquisition; individual differences in second language learning; social and linguistic issues in second language acquisition; and principles of second language teaching, including course planning, methodology and materials design.
